schist.inference.leidenÂ¶

schist.inference.leiden(adata: anndata._core.anndata.AnnData, resolution: float = 1, samples: int = 100, *, restrict_to: Optional[Tuple[str, Sequence[str]]] = None, random_state: Union[None, int, numpy.random.mtrand.RandomState] = 0, key_added: str = 'leiden', adjacency: Optional[scipy.sparse.base.spmatrix] = None, directed: bool = True, use_weights: bool = True, n_iterations: int = - 1, partition_type: Optional[Type[leidenalg.VertexPartition.MutableVertexPartition]] = None, neighbors_key: Optional[str] = None, obsp: Optional[str] = None, collect_marginals: bool = True, n_jobs: int = - 1, copy: bool = False, save_model: Optional[str] = None, dispatch_backend: Optional[str] = 'processes', **partition_kwargs) → Optional[anndata._core.anndata.AnnData]Â¶

Cluster cells into subgroups [Traag18].

Cluster cells using the Leiden algorithm [Traag18], an improved version of the Louvain algorithm [Blondel08]. It has been proposed for single-cell analysis by [Levine15].

This requires having ran neighbors() or bbknn() first.

Parameters

  • adata â The annotated data matrix.

  • resolution â A parameter value controlling the coarseness of the clustering. Higher values lead to more clusters. Set to None if overriding partition_type to one that doesnât accept a resolution_parameter. samples

  • samples â The number of random samples to take for consensus

  • random_state â Change the initialization of the optimization.

  • restrict_to â Restrict the clustering to the categories within the key for sample annotation, tuple needs to contain (obs_key, list_of_categories).

  • key_added â adata.obs key under which to add the cluster labels.

  • adjacency â Sparse adjacency matrix of the graph, defaults to neighbors connectivities.

  • directed â Whether to treat the graph as directed or undirected.

  • use_weights â If True, edge weights from the graph are used in the computation (placing more emphasis on stronger edges).

  • n_iterations â How many iterations of the Leiden clustering algorithm to perform. Positive values above 2 define the total number of iterations to perform, -1 has the algorithm run until it reaches its optimal clustering.

  • partition_type â Type of partition to use. Defaults to RBConfigurationVertexPartition. For the available options, consult the documentation for find_partition().

  • neighbors_key â Use neighbors connectivities as adjacency. If not specified, leiden looks .obsp[âconnectivitiesâ] for connectivities (default storage place for pp.neighbors). If specified, leiden looks .obsp[.uns[neighbors_key][âconnectivities_keyâ]] for connectivities.

  • obsp â Use .obsp[obsp] as adjacency. You canât specify both obsp and neighbors_key at the same time.

  • collect_marginals â Wheter to retrieve the marginal probability to belong to a group

  • n_jobs â Number of parallel jobs to calculate partitions

  • copy â Whether to copy adata or modify it inplace.

  • save_model â If provided, this will be the filename for the PartitionModeState to be saved

  • **partition_kwargs â Any further arguments to pass to ~leidenalg.find_partition (which in turn passes arguments to the partition_type).

Returns

  • adata.obs[key_added] â Array of dim (number of samples) that stores the subgroup id (â0â, â1â, â¦) for each cell.

  • adata.uns[âleidenâ][âparamsâ] â A dict with the values for the parameters resolution, random_state, and n_iterations.
